team|England U20]] | nationalcaps4 = 2 | nationalgoals4 = 1 | club-update = 1 January 2018 | nationalteam-update = }} '''Isaiah Jay "Izzy" Brown''' (born 7 January 1997) is an English professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as an [[attacking midfielder]], [[Forward (association football)|forward]] or a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] for [[Football League Championship|Championship]] club [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]], on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]. He represents the [[England national under-20 football team|England national under-20 team]]. Brown played for [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]]'s academy and under-21 teams before making his senior debut in 2013. Since signing for Chelsea, he has played for their senior team.{{cite web|title=Under-21s win warm-up away|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/under21s-article/article/3326204/title/under-21s-win-warm-up-away|publisher=chelseafc.com|date=23 July 2013|accessdate=27 July 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130801003019/http://www.chelseafc.com/under21s-article/article/3326204/title/under-21s-win-warm-up-away|archivedate=1 August 2013|df=dmy-all}} ==Early life== Brown was born in [[Peterborough]], Cambridgeshire. ==Club career== ===West Bromwich Albion=== On 2 March 2013, Brown made the [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] bench for the first time in an away league match against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], an unused substitute as West Brom lost 1–0.{{cite web|title=Chelsea 1–0 West Brom|url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/statistics/id/345614/statistics.html|publisher=ESPN|accessdate=11 December 2014}} On 6 April 2013, again Brown made the bench and was again not used as West Brom lost 2–1 to Arsenal at [[The Hawthorns]].{{cite web|title=West Brom 1–2 Arsenal|url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/statistics/id/345575/statistics.html|publisher=ESPN|accessdate=11 December 2014}} Brown made his debut for West Bromwich Albion on 4 May 2013 in a 3–2 home [[Premier League]] defeat by [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]], replacing [[Youssouf Mulumbu]] for the last four minutes{{cite web|title=West Brom 2–3 Wigan|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22320485|work=BBC Sport|accessdate=4 May 2013}} and becoming the second-youngest player in Premier League history at the age of 16 years and 117 days.{{cite web|title=Saturday Sundae: West Brom throw Brown boy in the ring|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2013/may/04/saturday-sundae-west-brom-isaiah-brown|publisher=guardian.co.uk|date=4 May 2013|accessdate=8 July 2013}} On 8 July 2013, West Bromwich Albion rejected an offer for Brown from Chelsea.{{cite web|title=Albion reject Chelsea offer for Brown|url=http://www.wba.co.uk/news/article/albion-reject-chelsea-offer-for-brown-902287.aspx|publisher=wba.co.uk|accessdate=8 July 2013}} Later that month, Chelsea confirmed that they had signed Brown,{{cite web|title=Isaiah Brown|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/academy-article/article/3326285|publisher=chelseafc.com|accessdate=27 July 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130921032122/http://www.chelseafc.com/academy-article/article/3326285|archivedate=21 September 2013|df=dmy-all}} with compensation between the clubs reportedly set to be decided by a tribunal.{{cite web|title=Tribunal will settle West Brom's Isaiah Brown cash tussle|url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/west-bromwich-albion-fc/2013/07/26/tribunal-will-settle-west-broms-isaiah-brown-cash-tussle/|publisher=expressandstar.com|date=26 July 2013|accessdate=27 July 2013}} After Brown left the club West Brom's chairman considered scrapping the club's category one development academy as the [[Elite Player Performance Plan|EPPP]] rules Chelsea used to sign Brown meant that the club were losing their best prospects for nominal fees that failed to cover the cost of running an academy.{{cite web|url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/west-bromwich-albion-fc/2013/07/02/jeremy-peace-could-scrap-west-brom-academy/ |title=Jeremy Peace could scrap West Brom academy|work=Express & Star |date=2 July 2013 |accessdate=2015-05-18}} ===Chelsea=== [[File:Isaiah Brown.jpg|thumb|upright|Brown playing for [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] under-18s in 2015]] Brown scored his first goals for the Chelsea first team on 16 July 2014 in a 5–0 pre-season friendly victory over [[Wycombe Wanderers F.C.|Wycombe Wanderers]].{{cite web|url=http://hereisthecity.com/en-gb/2014/07/16/photo-chelsea-wonderkid-izzy-brown-celebrates-first-chelsea-goal/ |title=Chelsea wonderkid Izzy Brown celebrates first Chelsea goals v Wycombe|publisher=Hereisthecity.com |date=2014-07-16 |accessdate=2015-05-18}} On 29 July 2014, Chelsea manager [[José Mourinho]] said that he should be blamed if Brown were not to become a senior [[England national football team|England]] international under his management.{{cite web|last=Todd |first=Oliver |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2709249/Jose-Mourinho-says-Chelsea-kids-Lewis-Baker-Izzy-Brown-Dominic-Solanke-dont-play-England-blame-ME.html |title=Jose Mourinho says if Chelsea kids Lewis Baker, Izzy Brown and Dominic Solanke don't play for England, 'blame me!|work=Daily Mail |date=2014-07-29 |accessdate=2015-05-18}} On 28 October, Brown made the Chelsea bench for the first time in a competitive fixture, but was an unused substitute as Chelsea beat [[Shrewsbury Town]] 2–1 to advance into quarter-finals of the League Cup.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/29699744 |title=Shrewsbury Town 1–2 Chelsea |work=BBC Sport |date=27 October 2014 |accessdate=11 December 2014 }} On 31 January 2015, Brown made the Chelsea bench against current league title holders, Manchester City, but was again an unused substitute as Chelsea drew 1–1.{{cite news|last1=McNulty|first1=Phil|title=Chelsea 1–1 Man City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30963477|accessdate=31 January 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=31 January 2015}} Three days after the match, on 3 February, Brown was promoted into Mourinho's first team squad alongside fellow teenager [[Ruben Loftus-Cheek]].{{cite web|title=Ruben Loftus-Cheek, Izzy Brown promoted to Chelsea's first team|url=http://weaintgotnohistory.sbnation.com/2015/2/3/7971887/ruben-loftus-cheek-izzy-brown-chelsea-fc-first-team|accessdate=3 February 2015|work=SB Nations|date=3 February 2015}}{{cite web|title=More Academy graduates in first team squad|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2015/02/more-academy-graduates-in-first-team-squad.html|accessdate=3 February 2015 |work=Chelseafc.com|date=3 February 2015 }} On 12 April, Brown was named on the first team bench for the third time that season for a West London derby against [[Queens Park Rangers]].{{cite web|last=Higginson |first=Marc |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32187758 |title=Queens Park Rangers 0–1 Chelsea |work=BBC Sport |date=12 April 2015 |accessdate=2015-05-18}} Less than 24 hours later he captained Chelsea U19 in the final of the 2014–15 [[UEFA Youth League]] against [[Shakhtar Donetsk]] in Switzerland and put in a man of the match performance scoring twice to help Chelsea take the title.{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefayouthleague/season=2015/matches/round=2000561/match=2016409/postmatch/report/index.html#brown+inspires+chelsea+youth+league+glory |title=Brown inspires Chelsea to Youth League glory|publisher=UEFA.com |date=2015-04-13 |accessdate=2015-05-18}} On 18 May, Brown made his Chelsea debut, coming off the bench for [[Loïc Rémy]] for the final eleven minutes of a 3–0 defeat at his former club West Bromwich Albion.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32686137|last=|first=|title=West Brom 3–0 Chelsea|date=18 May 2015|work=BBC Sport|accessdate=18 May 2015}} Although Brown only made one league appearances out of the whole season, [[José Mourinho]] stated that he would receive a winner's medal for his contributions this season.{{cite news|url=http://www.espnfc.com/chelsea/story/2450893/jose-mourinho-every-chelsea-player-to-get-prem-medal |title=Every Chelsea player to get a Premier League medal says Jose Mourinho|work=ESPN FC |date=15 May 2015 |accessdate=3 July 2017}} ====Vitesse (loan)==== On 10 July 2015, Chelsea agreed to a deal that will see Brown go on [[Loan (sports)|loan]] to Dutch side [[SBV Vitesse|Vitesse]] along with new signing [[Nathan Allan de Souza|Nathan]].{{cite web |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2015/07/brown-and-nathan-in-dutch-loan.html |title=Brown and Nathan in Dutch loan |accessdate=10 July 2015 |publisher=Chelsea F.C.}} A week later, Brown made his debut and played for the entire first half in a friendly 1–0 win against the Turkish side [[Çaykur Rizespor]].{{cite web |url=http://www.vitesse.nl/nl/nieuws/detail/5113/vitesse-verslaat-rizespor-in-seekirchen-1-0 |title=Vitesse verslaat Rizespor in Seekirchen: 1–0 |language=Dutch |accessdate=18 July 2015 |date=17 July 2015 |publisher=Vitesse}} He made his competitive debut 13 days later in a [[UEFA Europa League]] third qualifying round first leg against [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] at [[St. Mary's Stadium|St. Mary's]], playing the full 90 minutes of a 3–0 defeat.{{cite news|last1=Williams|first1=Adam|title=Southampton 3–0 Vitesse|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33667103|accessdate=7 August 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=30 July 2015}} On 6 March 2016, Brown scored his first senior goal, giving Vitesse the lead in the 34th minute in their 2–1 victory over [[Roda JC Kerkrade]].{{Cite news |title=Roda JC Kerkrade vs. Vitesse (1 : 2) |url=https://www.onefootball.com/en-US/match/roda-jc-kerkrade-vs-vitesse-overview-36-431944?period=FullTime&variable=g3 |publisher=OneFootball |date=6 March 2016 |access-date=6 March 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160618142538/https://www.onefootball.com/en-US/match/roda-jc-kerkrade-vs-vitesse-overview-36-431944?period=FullTime&variable=g3 |archive-date=18 June 2016 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }} ====Rotherham United (loan)==== On 15 August 2016, Brown joined [[EFL Championship|Championship]] side [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham United]] on loan until the end of the 2016–17 season.{{cite news |title=Millers complete Brown deal|url=http://www.themillers.co.uk/news/article/2016-17/rotherham-united-chelsea-izzy-brown-3249823.aspx|publisher=Rotherham United F.C.|date=15 August 2016|accessdate=15 August 2016}} On 20 August 2016, Brown made his debut in a 1–0 victory over [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]].{{cite web|title=Rotherham United 1–0 Brentford|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37067355|work=BBC Sport|date=20 August 2016 }} On 10 September 2016, Brown scored his first goal after the opening six minutes of a 2–2 draw against [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37263311 |title=Rotherham United 2–2 Bristol City |date=10 September 2016 |work=BBC Sport}} On 10 December 2016, Brown went onto score the winner in a 1–0 home victory against [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]].{{Cite news |title=Rotherham United vs. Queens Park Rangers |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2016/12/10/england/championship/rotherham-united-fc/queens-park-rangers-fc/2246966/ |publisher=Soccerway |date=10 December 2016 |accessdate=5 January 2017}} The loan was terminated early by Chelsea on 6 January 2017.{{cite new|title=Izzy recalled by Chelsea|url=http://www.themillers.co.uk/news/article/2016-17/izzy-brown-rotherham-united-chelsea-3505429.aspx|publisher=Rotherham United F.C.|accessdate=6 January 2017}} ====Huddersfield Town (loan)==== It was announced later that day that Brown had joined fellow Championship side [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] on loan for the remainder of the season.{{cite web|title=Chelsea send Izzy Brown on loan to Huddersfield Town after cutting short season-long spell at Rotherham United |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-4095008/Chelsea-send-Izzy-Brown-loan-Huddersfield-Town-cutting-short-season-long-spell-Rotherham-United.html|website=Daily Mail|last=Todd|first=Oliver|date=6 January 2017|accessdate=6 January 2017}} On 7 January 2017, Brown made his Huddersfield debut in an [[FA Cup]] tie against [[Port Vale F.C.|Port Vale]], which resulted in a 4–0 victory for the Championship side.{{Cite news |title=Huddersfield Town 4–0 Port Vale |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38475367 |work=BBC Sport |date=7 January 2017 |accessdate=21 January 2017}} Two weeks later, Brown scored his first goal for Huddersfield in a 2–0 victory against [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]], netting in the 41st minute.{{Cite news |title=Huddersfield Town 2–0 Ipswich Town |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38619009 |work=BBC Sport |date=21 January 2017 |accessdate=21 January 2017}} On 5 February 2017, Brown scored for Huddersfield with his first touch after coming on as a first half substitute in Huddersfield's 2–1 win in a [[West Yorkshire derby]] against rivals [[Leeds United]].{{Cite news|url=http://www.squawka.com/en/news/izzy-browns-chelsea-pedigree-is-clear-to-see-at-huddersfield-says-noel-whelan/897402#aCZ8ZghxMGsLM47k.97|title=Izzy Brown's Chelsea pedigree is clear to see at Huddersfield, says Noel Whelan|publisher=Squawka|date=6 February 2017}} Brown featured in Huddersfield's [[2017 EFL Championship play-off final|Championship play-off final]] victory against [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] on 29 May 2017, playing 98 minutes before being substituted for fellow Chelsea loanee [[Kasey Palmer]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39995791|title=Play-off Final: Huddersfield 0–0 Reading (Huddersfield 4–3 Reading pens)|publisher=BBC Sport|date=29 May 2017}} Brown scored five Championship goals for Huddersfield throughout his loan spell at the club, and was linked with a permanent move in the summer following their promotion to the Premier League, however such a move failed to materialise.{{Cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/06/19/huddersfield-advanced-talks-chelsea-8m-izzy-brown-signing/|title=Huddersfield in advanced talks with Chelsea over £8m Izzy Brown signing|publisher=''The Daily Telegraph''|work=John Percy|date=19 June 2017}} ====Brighton & Hove Albion (loan)==== On 25 July 2017, Brown joined newly promoted Premier League club [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] on a season-long loan.{{cite web|title=Izzy Brown signs four-year Chelsea deal and joins Brighton on season-long loan |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/izzy-brown-signs-fouryear-chelsea-deal-and-joins-brighton-on-seasonlong-loan-a3595741.html}} He made his debut for Brighton on 12 August, in their 2–0 defeat to [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] on the opening day of the season. Brown suffered an injury early in the match, and was substituted for [[Jamie Murphy (footballer, born 1989)|Jamie Murphy]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40835422|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 0–2 Manchester City|publisher=BBC Spirt|date=12 August 2017}} Brown made his return from injury on 1 October, starting as a striker for Brighton in a 2–0 away defeat to [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41376506|title=Arsenal 2–0 Brighton & Hove Albion|publisher=BBC Sport|date=1 October 2017}} On 8 January 2018, in Brighton's 2–1 FA Cup victory over [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]], Brown suffered an [[anterior cruciate ligament injury]] and missed the rest of the season.{{Cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-5251723/Brighton-forward-Izzy-Brown-miss-rest-season.html|title=Chelsea loanee Izzy Brown confirms he will miss the rest of the season with a torn ACL after limping off in Brighton's FA Cup victory|publisher=Daily Mail|date=9 January 2018}} Brown made 15 appearances in all competitions for Brighton throughout his loan spell, many coming as a substitute. ====Leeds United (loan)==== On 30 August 2018, Brown joined [[EFL Championship]] side [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] on a season long loan.{{cite news |title=Izzy Brown: Leeds United sign Chelsea forward on season-long loan|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45356362|newspaper=BBC Sport |date=30 August 2018 |accessdate=30 August 2018}} After joining the club, whilst still carrying out his rehabilitation recovering from his existing [[cruciate ligament]] injury, on 16 November 2018, Brown made his first appearance in a Leeds shirt in a 3–0 defeat for Leeds' Under 23's against Birmingham City Under 23's side.{{cite news |title=CLUB STATEMENT: JAMAL BLACKMAN|url=https://www.leedsunited.com/news/team-news/24127/jamal-blackman |publisher=Leeds United |date=16 November 2018 |accessdate=16 November 2018}}{{cite news |title=U23 REPORT: LEEDS UNITED 0-3 BIRMINGHAM CITY|url=https://www.leedsunited.com/news/academy-news/24125/u23-preview-leeds-united-vs-birmingham |publisher=Leeds United |date=16 November 2018 |accessdate=16 November 2018}} However, he picked up a hamstring injury in his recovery which ruled him out of contention.{{cite news |title=Samuel Saiz departure poses on-field questions for Leeds United as Izzy Brown wait goes on|url=https://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/sport/football/leeds-united/samuel-saiz-departure-poses-on-field-questions-for-leeds-united-as-izzy-brown-wait-goes-on-1-9499722|publisher=YEP |date=19 December 2019 |accessdate=5 February 2019}} In February 2019, Rob Price Leeds' Head of Medicine revealed that Brown was now 'fully fit'.{{cite news |title=Gaetano Berardi 'avoided season-ending surgery' in bid to rejoin Leeds United's Championship promotion bid|url=https://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/sport/football/leeds-united/gaetano-berardi-avoided-season-ending-surgery-in-bid-to-rejoin-leeds-united-s-championship-promotion-bid-1-9575650|publisher=YEP |date=5 February 2019 |accessdate=5 February 2019}} Brown was named in a first team squad for the first time in over a year after recovering from injury, when he was named on the bench as an unused substitute in Leeds' 1-1 draw against [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] on 9 February 2019.{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2019/feb/09/middlesbrough-leeds-united-championship-match-report |title=Leeds’ Kalvin Phillips rescues point at Boro after Clarke taken to hospital|publisher=The Guardian|date=9 February 2019 |accessdate=19 February 2019}} On 26 February 2019, Brown made his debut with Leeds as a late substitute in a 1-0 defeat against [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]]. {{cite news |title= QPR 1-0 Leeds|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/47287438 |date=26 February 2018 |accessdate= 2 March 2019}} ==International career== [[File:France - England U19, 20150331 54.jpg|thumb|upright|Brown playing for England U19s in 2015]] Brown has represented England at [[England national under-16 football team|under-16]], [[England national under-17 football team|under-17]], [[England national under-19 football team|under-19]] and [[England national under-20 football team|under-20]] levels.{{cite web |title=Isaiah Brown |url=http://www.thefa.com/england/All-Teams/Players?p=353149 |publisher=The Football Association |accessdate=16 August 2017}} ==Style of play== Brown can play as a [[attacking midfielder]], [[Forward (association football)|forward]] or as a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]]. He says his favoured position is as a [[Midfielder|number 10]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.football.london/chelsea-fc/players/exclusive-izzy-brown-improving-huddersfield-13105336|title=Izzy Brown on improving at Huddersfield, the truth behind Chelsea's Whatsapp group and his future|publisher=''Football London''|date=11 August 2018}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 8 January 2018}}
